comments:
Build: I-20030813
I started my workbench and I noticed that the CVS decorators are not there.  I 
thought it was a problem with the decorators, but then I realized that the 
team cvs plug-in failed to start.
Here is the first exception in my log which led to several subsequent class 
loading errors:

I have just witnessed this as well. It happened when I had a merge subscriber
persisted accross workbench invocations. Will investigate.

This could be related to bug 5875. What Windows VM did you get the exception 
with?

This is indeed the same problem as bug 5875. The decorator thread is loading 
the CVS decorators which cause the Team plugin to startup which, in turn tries 
to load a CVS class through an extension point. We should try to avoid 
accessing extension points during startup in Team. Perhaps the load can be 
performed when the list of subscribers is first accessed.

Fix released to HEAD. I've refactored the TeamProvider into an 
ISubscriberManager/SubscriberManager and changed initialization to occur upon 
first access instead of startup.
